summary: The document is a collection of records from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), focusing on staff payroll records for Paul T. Golden. It includes various forms and memoranda related to his employment, such as a payroll authorization form, a memorandum on payroll certification, and a notification of his employment. The document also mentions the Assassination Records Review Board's final determination, highlighting the redaction or postponement of certain information, like Social Security numbers, for privacy reasons. This document is part of the JFK Assassination Records Collection and was reviewed under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992.
key_findings: Payroll records for Paul T. Golden, an HSCA employee, detailing his position, salary, and employment authorization are included.
Social Security numbers were redacted or postponed to safeguard personal privacy, as decided by the Assassination Records Review Board.
This document is a component of the JFK Assassination Records Collection, reviewed under legislation focused on the disclosure of assassination-related records.
A memorandum within the document outlines the necessity for staff to disclose any connections to current Members of Congress during payroll certification.
